page.title: 12 A NEW RAILWAY ?
page.content: In the south western corner of the Domesday block is a disused railway line.The Grimsby Louth Railway Preservation Society plan to open the line again and run trains on it.They hope that trains will begin running again in Autumn 1986 when they open a small section of line south of New Waltham .When the railway does re-open it will be called the Great Northern East Lincolnshire Railway. On March 1st 1848 the Grimsby Louth Railway line was opened and the first trains ran.The company that ran the trains was the Great Northern Railway.People were able to travel from Grimsby right through to London and many stations in between.The line was often used for speed tests because it was so straight.The line was closed to main traffic in 1976.
